identificationModule.briefTitle: Do Dietary Patterns Influence Your Weight Management and Circadian Rhythms?
identificationModule.officialTitle: Do Dietary Patterns Influence Your Weight Management and Circadian Rhythms?

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this clinical trial is to test the effects of dietary composition on the rhythms of food intake, appetite regulation, and rhythms of energy expenditure.

Participants will:

complete 2 field-based dietary interventions be provided with standard meals record daily food intake in a real-time manner complete 2 inpatient stays be provided with standard meals have frequent blood draws provide urine, saliva, and stool samples
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Obesity is an ongoing epidemic and a serious public health problem. Recent insights into the involvement of the circadian system (i.e., an internal biological rhythm) in energy expenditure and appetite control offer a new perspective to understand the relationship between dietary composition and weight management. Particularly, dietary composition may impact whole-body physiology in part through changes in the circadian system. The study protocol is designed to test the effects of dietary composition, on the rhythms of food intake and appetite regulation, and rhythms of energy expenditure. This study seeks to understand the relationship between dietary composition and weight control in order to lay the groundwork for evidence-based dietary intervention to combat obesity.

armGroups.label: Dietary A-B Intervention
armGroups.description: The Dietary A first, then the Dietary B intervention. Since this is a single blind study, the details of the dietary interventions cannot be released during recruitment stage but will be made public once enrollment closes.

armGroups.label: Dietary B-A Intervention
armGroups.description: The Dietary B first, then the Dietary A intervention. Since this is a single blind study, the details of the dietary interventions cannot be released during recruitment stage but will be made public once enrollment closes.

interventions.name: dietary intervention
interventions.description: Research participants will be assigned to two dietary conditions.

primaryOutcomes.description: Hourly plasma melatonin will be measured under the Constant Routine condition

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of daily caloric intake in the biological evening
primaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of caloric intake within the 4 hours before bedtime will be derived from real-time record of food and beverage intake during the intervention period

secondaryOutcomes.description: Hourly circulating melatonin will be measured under the Constant Routine condition

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Circadian amplitude of subjective hunger rhythms
secondaryOutcomes.description: Hourly subjective hunger will be measured by Visual Analog Scale under the Constant Routine condition

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase of resting energy expenditure
secondaryOutcomes.description: Every other hour energy expenditure will be measured by indirect calorimetry under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Diurnal variations of postprandial ghrelin responses
otherOutcomes.description: Postprandial circulating ghrelin will be measured at test meals on Test Day
Circulating leptin will be measured hourly on Test Day

otherOutcomes.measure: Diurnal profile of subjective hunger ratings
otherOutcomes.description: Hourly subjective hunger will be measured by Visual Analog Scale on Test Day

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian amplitude of resting energy expenditure
otherOutcomes.description: Every other hour resting energy expenditure will be measured by indirect calorimetry under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Diurnal profile of resting energy expenditure
otherOutcomes.description: Indirect calorimetry will be done 30 minutes before each test meal and three 30-minute postprandial tests starting at 30, 90, and 240 min after each test meal on Test day by indirect calorimetry

otherOutcomes.measure: Diurnal profile of respiratory exchange ratio
otherOutcomes.description: Respiratory exchange ratio will be measured 30 minutes before each test meal and three 30-minute postprandial tests starting at 30, 90, and 240 min after each test meal on Test Day by indirect calorimetry

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian amplitude and phase of respiratory exchange ratio
otherOutcomes.description: Every other hour respiratory exchange ratio will be measured by indirect calorimetry under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase and amplitude of glucose rhythm
otherOutcomes.description: Hourly circulating glucose will be measured under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase and amplitude of insulin rhythm
otherOutcomes.description: Hourly circulating insulin will be measured under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase and amplitude of cortisol rhythm
otherOutcomes.description: Hourly circulating cortisol will be measured under the Constant Routine condition

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase and amplitude of core body temperature rhythm
otherOutcomes.description: Core body temperature will be measured continuously under the Constant Routine condition
Hourly circulating lipids will be measured on Test Day

otherOutcomes.measure: Circadian phase and amplitude of lipids
otherOutcomes.description: Hourly circulating lipids will be measured under Constant Routine condition

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18-45 yr old
* BMI 18.5-29.9
* No acute, chronic or debilitating medical conditions (e.g. metabolic, cardiovascular, respiratory, neurological, cancers, etc.)
* Without medication use (except oral contraceptives)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Currently smoking/vaping or 5 or more years of smoking/vaping
* History of drug or alcohol dependency
* History of psychiatric illness or disorder
* People with food allergies/intolerances or following specific diets
